'Silver chloride' is a chemical compound with the chemical formula AgCl. This
white crystalline solid is well known for its low solubility in water (this
behavior being reminiscent of the chlorides of Tl + and
Pb 2+ ). Upon illumination or heating, silver chloride converts to
silver (and chlorine), which is signaled by greyish or purplish coloration to
some samples. AgCl occurs naturally as a mineral chlorargyrite.
